results.title: Heroes Unsung
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger”.
Part One of a three part series which explores aspects of Australia’s history. In this part, John Pilger traces the history of Australian immigration, from a personal perspective, from the horrors of the First Fleet through to the “White Australia” policy and the post-war “Populate or Perish” program. He challenges Australia’s treasured stereotypes and self-image and instead shows the great hardships suffered by marginalised and oppressed of Australia, in the process of building the nation.

results.title: Immigration: the waves that shaped Australia (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Paul Woolston-Smith and Dept of Immigration and Ethnic Affairs
results.brief_description: This video outlines the migrations which have made us what we are - starting with the arrival of First Nations peoples. The landing on the 26th January, 1788, of the officers, marines and convicts of the First Fleet, started successive waves of mostly European migration whose cultures enriched our nation.

results.title: Getting better
results.creator_credit: Larry Lucas, Yuri Sokol, Michael Le Moignan, Australian Film Commission and Corroboree Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Black futures (A)”.
The life expectancy of Australian First Nations people is decades less than that of white Australians. But things are changing. First Nations people are taking control of their own health care. They are trying to combine the best elements of Western medicine with their own medical science.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry Lucas, Yuri Sokol, Michael Le Moignan, Australian Film Commission and Corroboree Films

results.title: A Shame like Alice. Parts. 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, Lee Gordon Productions and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.

In March 1983 Focus spent one week in the Northern Territory looking at the living conditions of First Nations people in the most famous small town in Australia, Alice Springs. Includes interviews with Neville Bonner and Al Grassby.

results.title: Understanding is not enough
results.creator_credit: Alison Head, Keith Head, Indignata Filmnic and Uniting Church in Australia
results.brief_description: A documentary about the Uniting Church and the liaison work it is involved in with the First Nations people in Victoria. By interviewing those involved in the liaison work, the film examines the lived experience of some First Nations people in Victoria.

results.title: The Quinkins
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gagne and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A group of First Nations storytellers combined their talents to create the pictures and sound for this traditional tale of conflict between the Imnims and the Timaras in Dreamtime. Uses the illustrations from the book of the same name by Dick Roughsey and Percy Trezise.

results.title: Northern Territory Contact. No. 12
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Solar village. In the little township of Nguiu, on Bathurst Island a solar power plant run by First Nations people, has been built, which supplies electricity to the settlement of 800 people.

results.title: Weipa people
results.creator_credit: Edwin Scragg, Jane Scragg, Comalco and Scope Films
results.brief_description: A film about the largest bauxite mining operation in the world. Also looks at the social conditions of the people who have moved to this remote North Queensland town and the impact of the new town on local First Nations peoples. Commentary by Richard Oxenburgh.

results.title: People out of time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A study of the Bindubi tribe, Australian First Nations people who have mastered their arid, inhospitable environment in the Great Sandy Desert by using every resource to the maximum point of refinement. Filmed on Professor Donald Thompson’s 1963 expedition. Narrated by Leo McKern, filmed by David Corke and Len McLarty, written and presented by Eric Davidson.

results.title: Aborigines of the Northern Territory: scouting outpost
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Cinesound Movietone
results.brief_description: Scouting has become an important activity among young children of Maningrida on the Arafura Sea in Northern Australia. In 1964 a school teacher introduced scouting, and its popularity led to the growth of the movement to include Cubs, Rovers and Guides. Young people from eleven First Nations peoples in the area are involved.
